member.summary: Gets the description of the new food truck

member.summary: Gets the Website of the new food truck

member.name: P:FoodTruckNationApi.ApiModels.CreateFoodTruckModel.Tags
member.summary: Gets a list of tags to be attached to the new food truck.
member.remarks: This list is just a list of strings, so the application has to match these strings up with tag objects in the system. Also, some tags may exist, some may not, so it is up to the application to determine this and treat each tag appropriately.

member.name: T:FoodTruckNationApi.ApiModels.UpdateFoodTruckModel
member.summary: Model used to update the properties of a Food Truck
member.remarks: This object is intended to be used in a PUT operation to the API. Therefore, every field on the food truck will be updated with the information in this object. Therefore, if there is a field you do not want changed, then you need to populate that field with its current value in this object

member.summary: The name to give a food truck

member.summary: The website of the food truck

member.name: F:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckReviewsController.GET_ALL_FOOD_TRUCK_REVIEWS
member.summary: Route name for the route that gets all reviews for a food truck

member.summary: Route name for the route that gets a single review for a food truck

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckReviewsController.Get(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets all of the reviews for the specified food truck
member.param: The int of the unique id number of the food truck
member.returns: An IActionResult containing the list of reviews for the food truck
member.response: Success. A list of reviews for the food truck is being returned
Not Found. No food truck was found with the given id
Internal Server Error. An unexpected error internal to the application has occured. The error has been logged automatically by the system.

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckReviewsController.Get(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an individual review for a food truck, as specified by the food truck id and the review id
member.param: The int of the unique id number of the food truck
The int of the id number of the review
member.response: Success. The specified review is being returned
Not Found. Either no food truck was found with the given id or no review was found for this truck with the specified id
Internal Server Error. An unexpected error internal to the application has occured. The error has been logged automatically by the system.

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckReviewsController.Post(System.Int32,FoodTruckNationApi.ApiModels.CreateReviewModel)
member.summary: Creates a new review for the specified food truck
member.param: The int of the unique id number of the food truck to create a review for
member.response: Created. The new review was successfully created. A ReviewModel object for the review is returned and a link to the endpoint is included in the Location header
Bad Request. The request was invalid. A list of errors will be returned
Not Found. No food truck was found with the given id so no review could be added
Internal Server Error. An unexpected error internal to the application has occured. The error has been logged automatically by the system.

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckSchedulesController.Get(System.Int32,FoodTruckNationApi.ApiModels.DateRangeModel)
member.summary: Gets all the Schedules (appointments) for a Food Truck in the given date range
member.param: An int of the food truck id
member.response: Success. A list of location schedule objects of what food trucks are scheduled at this location are returned
Not Found. The requested location id could not be found
Internal Server Error. An unexpected error occured. This error has been logged so support personel can troubleshoot the problem

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckSchedulesController.Delete(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deleted the given schedule for the food truck
member.param: The id of the food truck the schule is for
The id of the schedule
member.response: Success. A message is returned to confirm the deletion
Not Found. Either the food truck of the schedule could not be found (the message will indicate which one)
Internal Server Error. An unexpected error occured. This error has been logged so support personel can troubleshoot the problem

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTrucksController.Post(FoodTruckNationApi.ApiModels.CreateFoodTruckModel)
member.summary: Creates a new food truck with the supplied information
member.param: A CreateFoodTruckModel object with the information needed to create the food truck
member.response: Success. The new food truck has been created
Conflict. A food truck with the same name found so this food truck could not be created
Internal Server Error

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTrucksController.Put(System.Int32,FoodTruckNationApi.ApiModels.UpdateFoodTruckModel)
member.summary: Updates the core data elements of a food truck.
member.remarks:
This endpoint only updates the properties directly on the food truck. To change elements on 'child' objects of the food truck (tags, social media accounts, reviews, schedules), you need to look in the appropriate association controller, for example FoodTruckTagsController.
This decision was made because when editing a food truck, I think it is more likely someone will just want to edit elements like the name or description. It seemed unnatural to make them also include the tags or social media accounts as part of the same update operation.
member.param: An int of the id of the food truck to update
An UpdateFoodTruckModel of the
member.response: Success. The food truck has been updated
No food truck with the given id could be found
Internal Server Error

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTrucksController.Delete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the food truck with the given id
member.param: An int of the food truck to be deleted
member.response: Success. The food truck has been deleted
No food truck with the given id could be found
Internal Server Error

member.summary: Gets the list of social media accounts for this food truck
member.param: The id number of this food truck
member.response: Success. A list of the current social media accounts for the food truck is returned
Not Found. No food truck could be found for this id
Internal Server Error. An unexpected problem occured on the server occured. The error has been logged by the server

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckSocialMediaController.Get(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a specific social media account for a food truck
member.param: The id of the food truck
The id of the social media account to fetch
member.response: Success. A corresponding social media account will be returned
Not Found. Either the food truck or the specified social media account could not be found
Internal Server Error. An unexpected problem occured on the server occured. The error has been logged by the server

member.summary: Creates a new Social Media Account for the specified food truck
member.param: The id of the food truck to create the social media account for
A model object containing the social media account information
member.response: Success. The social media account was created
Request error. The request contained invalid data, like an account name that does not correspond to the rules of this social media platform
Not Found. No food truck with the specified id could be found to create a social media account for
Conflict. This food truck already contains a social media account for the specified platform
Internal Server Error. An unexpected problem occured on the server occured. The error has been logged by the server

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckTagsController.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory,AutoMapper.IMapper,FoodTruckNation.Core.AppInterfaces.IFoodTruckService)
member.summary: Creates a new FoodTruckTagsController
member.param: An ILoggerFactory used to create the ILogger used by this controller
An Automapper IMapper object used for object mapping within this controller
An IFoodTruckService object that contains the business logic for food truck functions

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckTagsController.Get(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the list of tags on the specified food truck

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckTagsController.Post(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Adds the given tags to the food truck
member.remarks:
This endpoint allows you to add one or more tags to an existing food truck. The tags may already exist or they don't have to. New tags will automatically be created and added to the food truck
This response marks a departure from REST conventions in that I am returning the entire FoodTruckModel object rather than a list of the updated tags. This is a decision point and for this example, I am making the decision the client would most likely want an updated representation of the entire food truck, not just the list of tags

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckTagsController.Put(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Updates the list of tags to the food truck to the specified list
member.remarks:
This method effectively replaces the existing list of tags on the food truck with the list specified. Any new tags in the specified list are added to the food truck, where as any existing tags not included in the list will be removed from the food truck.
This response marks a departure from REST conventions in that I am returning the entire FoodTruckModel object rather than a list of the updated tags. This is a decision point and for this example, I am making the decision the client would most likely want an updated representation of the entire food truck, not just the list of tags
member.response: Success. A FoodTruckModel that represents the current state of the food truck is returned

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Controllers.FoodTruckTagsController.Delete(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the specified tag for the given food truck
member.response: Success. A message indicating the tag has been removed is returned

member.remarks: If no date range data is provided, then this enpoint will use a date range of the next seven days

An optional date range to get the scheduled food trucks for

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Startup.ConfigureServicesDI(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary: Helper method where all the dependency injection is configured
member.remarks: This code is split out into a helper method to keep the ConfigureServices method from getting too large. Having a separate helper method helps to keep each helper tightly focused on one job as well.

member.name: M:FoodTruckNationApi.Startup.ConfigureServicesSwagger(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary: Helper method to setup Swagger
